program_name: Central Hudson Targeted Demand Response (TDR) Program
description: The Central Hudson Targeted Demand Response (TDR) program is exclusively offered to commercial and industrial customers located in specific energy-constrained areas. The program uses demand response as an alternative to traditional growth-related infrastructure investments within targeted areas of Central Hudson's service territory, a strategy known as a 'non-wires alternative'. Participants commit to reduce their electricity usage at critical times during the summer season and receive monthly capacity payments.

service_territories: Energy-constrained areas within Central Hudson service territory
Lower Hudson Valley Capacity Zone (implemented May 2014)

customer_classes.size_threshold_notes: Program is designed for commercial and industrial customers only. Residential customers have separate TDM programs.

eligibility.aggregator_notes: Direct participants receive full rate. Aggregator participants receive negotiated rate.
additional_requirements: Must be located in eligible program area (energy-constrained zones)
Minimum 10 days of interval meter data required by enrollment deadline
TDR Program participants are not eligible to participate in CSRP Program

notification.notification_details: Day-ahead notices provided by 5 PM via email and phone. In-day notifications provided at least 2 hours prior to event start.

seasonal_rates.notes: 4-month season results in $27.30/kW total seasonal payment

capacity_rate.annual_equivalent_notes: Based on 4 months (June-September) at $6.825/kW-month = $27.30/kW per summer season

performance_rate.performance_notes: Performance determines payment percentage (0-100%). Must curtail committed load during events and test events. Participant incentives are paid based on actual seasonal-average reductions, calculated using the customer baseline load (CBL) baseline methodology.

penalty_structure.penalty_description: Penalties not explicitly stated in public materials. Performance requirements determine payment percentage.

payment_structure.payment_recipient_notes: Direct participants receive full rate ($6.825/kW-month). Aggregator participants receive negotiated rate.

seasons.season_notes: Program participation period is June 1 - September 30

call_windows.notes: Events occur between noon and 8 PM. Will not occur on weekends or federal holidays.
Test events scheduled between July 24-August 7, 2 PM - 6 PM on non-holiday weekdays

event_parameters.event_details: Typical events last 4 hours of curtailment. Emergency situations may require up to 8 hours. Emergency triggers include temperatures over 95 degrees or infrastructure loss. Events last 0.5-4 hours during standard operations.

nomination_bidding.nomination_deadline: May 31 for full season participation; June 30 for partial season participation

enrollment_period.enrollment_notes: Enrollments accepted up to May 1st for June 1st start date and up to June 1st for July 1st start date. May 31 deadline for full season participation, June 30 for partial season participation.

special_attributes: Can be stacked with NYISO Special Case Resource DR program
Uses Customer Baseline Load (CBL) methodology following NYISO standards

baseline_methodology.description: Customer Baseline Load (CBL) is calculated as the average hourly usage during the top 5 days out of the last 10 eligible weekdays
baseline_methodology.follows_standard: NYISO (New York Independent System Operator) methodology

testing_requirements.test_notes: If a demand response event is called prior to a test event being scheduled, there will no longer be a test event

program_history.historical_notes: Lower Hudson Valley Capacity Zone was implemented in May 2014, imposing electricity supply purchasing restrictions. FERC approved a plan in mid-2022 that allows for a broader range of energy resources, including renewables, to participate in the Hudson Valley's electric capacity market.

data_sources.source_name: Central Hudson Peak Perks - Targeted Demand Response Program Page
verified_data: Minimum capacity: 50kW
Typical event duration: 4 hours
Emergency event duration: up to 8 hours
Event window: noon to 8 PM
Notification: day-ahead by 5 PM, in-day minimum 2 hours prior
Seasonal capacity payment: $6.825/kW-month
Season: June 1 - September 30
Enrollment deadlines: May 31 (full season), June 30 (partial season)
Test requirement: 1-hour test annually between July 24-August 7
Baseline: CBL methodology (average of top 5 days from last 10 eligible weekdays)
Emergency triggers: temperatures over 95 degrees or infrastructure loss

data_sources.source_name: Central Hudson Commercial Demand Response Page
verified_data: TDR exclusively for customers in energy-constrained areas
Payment: $6.82/kW per month during June-September
Annual equivalent: $27.30/kW per summer
Requires interval metering
TDR participants not eligible for CSRP
Contact: CH.DLM@cenhud.com, 844-258-7761
Lower Hudson Valley Capacity Zone implemented May 2014
FERC approved plan mid-2022 for broader resource participation
Program targets transmission-constrained areas in Lower Hudson Valley

data_sources.source_name: Piclo Energy - Central Hudson Organization Page
verified_data: Payment confirmation: $27.30/kW each summer for load curtailment commitments
Program targets transmission-constrained areas

data_sources.source_name: Central Hudson Peak Perks Program Rules
verified_data: Conservation events: June 1 - September 30
Event window: noon to 8 PM
Event duration: 0.5-4 hours
No events on weekends or federal holidays

integration_metadata.notes: High-quality data available for capacity payments, event windows, and eligibility requirements. Performance payment rates not publicly specified. Historical event data not available through public sources. Program well-documented for commercial/industrial participation with clear geographic targeting to energy-constrained areas. BESS applications viable given minimum 50kW threshold and stacking opportunity with NYISO programs.
data_gaps: Historical event call data (dates, durations, advance notice)
Response time in minutes from notification

mutually_exclusive_with: Central Hudson Commercial System Relief Program (CSRP)
stackable_with: NYISO Special Case Resource DR program
program_relationships.notes: TDR Program participants are not eligible to participate in CSRP Program. However, customers in targeted areas can stack TDM (Targeted Demand Management) participation with the NYISO's Special Case Resource DR program for additional revenue opportunities.

metering_requirements.metering_notes: Interval metering is mandatory. Minimum 10 days of interval meter data required by enrollment deadline.

research_metadata.researcher_notes: Comprehensive research conducted across multiple authoritative sources. Payment structure is clearly documented: $6.825/kW-month for June-September season = $27.30/kW per summer (verified from multiple sources). Program is well-structured for commercial/industrial battery applications with 50kW minimum. Key data gap: performance payment rates are not publicly disclosed - requires direct contact with Central Hudson. Historical event data not available through public web sources. Geographic targeting to transmission-constrained Lower Hudson Valley areas confirmed. Program uses standard NYISO CBL methodology for baseline calculations. Notable feature: can stack with NYISO wholesale programs unlike CSRP. All financial data verified from official Central Hudson sources.
followup_items: Contact Central Hudson to obtain performance payment rates
Request historical event data for 2023-2024 seasons
Obtain detailed tariff document (P.S.C. No. 15 Electric Tariff)
Clarify exact geographic boundaries of eligible zones
Determine event response time requirements in minutes
Confirm BESS-specific participation requirements if any
